intro: Dumasia leiocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-seeded daisy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a flat, daisy-like head. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, with a smooth texture. Dumasia leiocarpa is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
